meanings.definition: Having color or a certain color.
meanings.sent1: The flowers were beautifully coloured in pink and purple hues.
meanings.sent2: The artist used various coloured paints to create a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The clown's wig was so brightly coloured that it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with coloured streaks of orange and red.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow appeared in the sky, displaying all the coloured bands beautifully.

meanings.definition: Of a person or their skin, not white.
meanings.sent1: The children played happily with their coloured friends at the park.
meanings.sent2: She admired the coloured artwork depicting diverse cultures.
meanings.sent3: The party had a fun theme where everyone dressed up as coloured characters.
meanings.sent4: Her coloured heritage was a blend of rich traditions and customs.
meanings.sent5: The neighbourhood was a mix of coloured families from different backgrounds.

meanings.sent1: She carefully coloured the picture with crayons, staying inside the lines.
meanings.sent2: The artist coloured the canvas with bold strokes of paint.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally coloured his hair green instead of brown with the dye.
meanings.sent4: The children coloured the walls of the classroom with their creative drawings.
meanings.sent5: The garden was coloured with blooming flowers of every shade imaginable.
